action.action-desc: Mr. Vela (for himself, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Ms. McSally, and Mr. Carter of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To designate the checkpoint of the United States Border Patrol located on United States Highway 77 North in Sarita, Texas, as the Javier Vega, Jr. Border Patrol Checkpoint.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Javier Vega, Jr. Memorial Act of 2017.

paragraph.text: A native of La Feria, Texas, Border Patrol Agent Javier Vega, Jr., served his country first a member of the United States Marines Corps and then proudly as a Border Patrol agent in the canine division with his dog, Goldie.
Agent Vega was assigned to the Kingsville, Texas, Border Patrol Station as a canine handler and worked primarily at the Sarita Border Patrol Checkpoint.
On August 3, 2014, Agent Vega was on a fishing trip with his family near Raymondville, Texas, when two criminal aliens attempted to rob and attack them.
Agent Vega was shot and killed while attempting to subdue the assailants and protect his family.
Agent Vega is survived by his wife, parents, three sons, brother, sister-in-law, niece, and dog, Goldie.

section.text: The checkpoint of the United States Border Patrol located on United States Highway 77 North in Sarita, Texas, shall be known and designated as the Javier Vega, Jr. Border Patrol Checkpoint.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the checkpoint described in section 3 shall be deemed to be a reference to the Javier Vega, Jr. Border Patrol Checkpoint.
